edges.name: Educated
edges.description: You may pick a bonus skill of your choice. Whenever you gain skill points from character level advancement, you get a bonus skill point.

edges.name: Face
edges.description: Gain Connect as a bonus skill. Once per game week, whenever it's convenient, gain one temporary Acquaintance Contact of your choice, describing them in any way the GM finds acceptable. You lose touch with this Contact after you use this Edge again, but you can use this Edge to connect with them again at a different time. You may also provide favors or payment sufficient to cement the relationship at the GM's discretion.

edges.name: Focused
edges.description: You begin play with an extra Focus pick. You may choose this Edge more than once.

edges.name: Ghost
edges.description: You are uncannily elusive. Gain Sneak as a bonus skill and the Fighting Withdrawal combat action is an On Turn action for you. Once per scene, reroll a failed Sneak check related to sneaking or going unseen. Once per game day, as a Move action, move up to 10 meters without anyone around you seeing you move. If you use this movement to get behind cover, you might seem to vanish outright to onlookers.

edges.name: Hacker
edges.description: Gain Program as a bonus skill. You may begin play with an installed Cranial Jack cybersystem, a scrap deck, and eight program elements of your choice among available Verbs and Subjects. Each round, you gain a bonus Main Action that can only be used to perform hacking or cyberspace-related mental actions. This does not include drone piloting or vehicle driving.

edges.name: Hard To Kill
edges.description: Instead of rolling 1d6 per level for your hit points, you roll 1d6+2. Your base Trauma Target increases by +1, turning the base 6 into 7.

edges.name: Killing Blow
edges.description: Gain a combat skill as a bonus skill. Whenever you inflict hit point damage on something, whether by weapon, special ability, or any other source, the damage is increased by 1 point per two character levels, rounded up. Any Trauma Die you roll gains a +1 bonus.

edges.name: Masterful Expertise
edges.description: Once per scene, as an Instant action, reroll a failed check for a non-combat skill.

edges.name: On Target
edges.description: Gain a combat skill as a bonus skill. Your basic attack bonus is equal to your character level, instead of the usual half level, rounded down.

edges.name: Operator’s Fortune
edges.description: You may or may not be good, but you are undeniably lucky. Once per game session as an Instant action, when something bad happens to you such as an injury, a failed save, or a botched skill check, test your luck and roll 1d6. On a 1, the bad event is unaffected. On a 2-5, you somehow avert the consequences by blind chance. On a 6, it actually lands on an enemy or rival of the GM's choice, if that's possible. Only events that happened in this same round can be averted.

edges.name: Veteran’s Luck
edges.description: Once per scene, as an Instant action, trigger this ability to gain one of two effects: an attack roll that just hit you is instead treated as a miss, or an attack roll you just made that missed is instead treated as a hit. This ability can be applied to vehicle weapons used by the operator, but it cannot protect against environmental damage, vehicle crashes, falls, or other harm that doesn't involve an attack roll.

edges.name: Voice of the People
edges.description: You are a rocker, graffiti artist, poet, demagogue, or other rabble-rouser with a considerable reputation. You gain both levels of the Pop Idol Focus and an additional Friend Contact related to your art.

edges.name: Wired
edges.description: You may begin play with up to $200,000 worth of new or secondhand cyber. If secondhand, you roll once per system for its defect and may end up with unusable junk. You don't need to pay for installation and its maintenance is covered for the next two months. You can redeem this Edge later in your career by paying double the cost of the cyber you selected; if so, you can trade this Edge in for a different one with the GM's approval.

cyberwarePackages.name: Cutter
cyberwarePackages.description: Powerful melee blades, higher resistance to Traumatic Hits, and a close-in brawler's edge.

items.name: Dermal Armor I
items.description: AC 16 vs. melee and ranged, +1 Trauma Target

cyberwarePackages.name: Gunner
cyberwarePackages.description: Hit with your Gunlink cyber and enhanced vision. Find the best gun you can get and keep out of melee range.

items.name: Gunlink
items.description: Ignore aim penalties, reroll a gun miss 1/scene

cyberwarePackages.name: Hacker or Driver
cyberwarePackages.description: Plug directly into hardware, survive neural hacking, silent comms, and remote-control drones or vehicles.

items.name: Cranial Jack
items.description: Can plug directly into jack-enabled hardware

items.name: Neural Buffer
items.description: Gain 3 HP/level versus neural hacking damage

items.name: Headcomm
items.description: Provides silent radio or cell communications

cyberwarePackages.name: Sneak
cyberwarePackages.description: Melee weapons come to you, no need for light or guards. Room in your budget for more cyber, but don't scout alone.

items.name: Stick Pads
items.description: Can cling to or climb sheer surfaces or overhangs

cyberwarePackages.name: Techie or Doc
cyberwarePackages.description: An Omnihand multi-tool for tech work. Includes 3 points of skillplugs (mental 1pt, physical 2pt).

items.name: Omnihand
items.description: +1 skill check once/scene for technical work

items.name: Skillplug Jack II
items.description: Can use level-1 physical or mental skill plugs

backgrounds.name: Drone Jockey
backgrounds.description: Pilot of security or utility drones.

backgrounds.name: Ganger
backgrounds.description: Rank and file member of a street gang.

backgrounds.name: Outlander
backgrounds.description: An outsider who learned to survive before learning the streets.

backgrounds.name: Researcher
backgrounds.description: Academic, lab scientist, or corporate R&D analyst.

foci.name: Ace Driver
foci.level_1: Gain Drive skill. Acquire $5k in vehicles. Reroll one failed driving/maintenance check per scene.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Drive as a bonus skill. You have “acquired” vehicles worth no more than the budget given on page 18, and can replace lost or destroyed gear at a rate of $10,000 per week. Once per scene, as an Instant action, reroll a failed skill check related to driving or vehicle maintenance and repair.
foci.level_2: Gain Fix skill. Vehicle Speed +1. Add one free mod to your vehicles.
foci.level_2_full: Gain Fix as a bonus skill. The Speed of a vehicle you drive is increased by 1 point. Once per vehicle, you can add a mod to it for free, ignoring money and experimental component costs. Only you can effectively operate this mod, but it requires no Maintenance. You can change this free mod with a week of downtime.

foci.name: Alert
foci.level_1: Gain Notice skill. Cannot be surprised or Execution Attacked. Roll initiative twice.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Notice as a bonus skill. You cannot be surprised, nor can others use the Execution Attack option on you. When your group rolls initiative, your vigilance allows them to roll twice and take the higher roll.
foci.level_2: Always act first in combat unless against another Level 2 Alert character.
foci.level_2_full: In addition to the benefits of level 1, you always act first in a combat round unless someone else involved is also this Alert.

foci.name: All Natural
foci.level_1: Gain any skill. Attribute mod +1. No major injuries. Gains attribute picks at levels 3, 5, 7, 10.
foci.level_1_full: Gain any skill as a bonus skill. Pick an attribute; its modifier increases by +1, up to a maximum of +3. You can make another such attribute pick at levels 3, 5, 7, and 10, choosing the same attribute or a different one. While you can still suffer Traumatic Hits, you never suffer major injuries as described on page 41. You cannot accept implants except for minor cosmetic ones with an unmodified System Strain cost of zero.
foci.level_2: N/A

foci.name: Armsmaster
foci.level_1: Gain Fight skill. Ready stowed weapons as Instant. Add Fight level to damage/Shock.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Fight as a bonus skill. You can Ready a Stowed melee or thrown weapon as an Instant action. You may add your Fight skill level to a melee or thrown weapon’s damage roll or Shock damage, assuming it has any to begin with.
foci.level_2: Melee Shock treats target as AC 10. +1 to hit with melee/thrown.
foci.level_2_full: The Shock from your melee attacks always treats the target as if they have AC 10. Gain a +1 bonus to hit with all thrown or melee attacks.

foci.name: Assassin
foci.level_1: Gain Sneak skill. Conceal small weapons easily. Point-blank surprise attacks cannot miss.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Sneak as a bonus skill. You can conceal an object no larger than a knife or pistol from anything less invasive than a strip search, including normal weapon detection devices. You can draw or produce this object as an On Turn action, and your point-blank ranged attacks made from surprise with it cannot miss the target.
foci.level_2: Take a Move action on the same round as an Execution Attack.
foci.level_2_full: You can take a Move action on the same round as you make an Execution Attack, closing rapidly with a target before you attack. You may split this Move action when making an Execution Attack, taking part of it before you murder your target and part of it afterwards. This movement happens too quickly to alert a victim or to be hindered by bodyguards not directly in your path.

foci.name: Authority
foci.level_1: Gain Talk skill. Once/day make request of NPC (Cha/Talk check vs Morale).
foci.level_1_full: Gain Talk as a bonus skill. Once per day, you can make a request from an NPC who is not openly hostile to you, rolling a Cha/Talk skill check at a difficulty of the NPC’s Morale score. If you succeed, they will comply with the request, provided it is not harmful or very uncharacteristic.
foci.level_2: Followers gain Morale/Hit bonuses equal to Talk skill and +1 to all skill checks.
foci.level_2_full: Those who follow you are fired with confidence. Any NPC being directly led by you gains a Morale and hit roll bonus equal to your Talk skill and a +1 bonus on all skill checks. Your followers will not act against your interests unless under extreme pressure.

foci.name: Close Combatant
foci.level_1: Gain combat skill. Use pistols in melee without penalty. Ignore melee Shock.
foci.level_1_full: Gain any combat skill as a bonus skill. You can use pistol-sized ranged weapons in melee without suffering penalties for the proximity of melee attackers. You ignore Shock damage from melee assailants, even if you’re unarmored at the time.
foci.level_2: Shock damage treats targets as AC 10. Fighting Withdrawal is an On Turn action.
foci.level_2_full: The Shock damage from your melee attacks treats all targets as if they were AC 10. The Fighting Withdrawal combat action is treated as an On Turn action for you and can be performed freely.

foci.name: Cyberdoc
foci.level_1: Gain Fix and Heal. Maintenance reduces System Strain by 1.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Fix and Heal as bonus skills. You start play with a cyberdoc kit, and you can implant cyberware even if your Heal skill is level-0. You gain a +2 bonus on all cyber implant surgery skill checks. If you perform cyber maintenance for a person, the delicacy of your adjustments decreases the total System Strain cost of their implants by one point until their next maintenance interval.
foci.level_2: Maintenance reduces System Strain by 2. Never fail an installation. Build one free mod per patient.
foci.level_2_full: The quality of your cyber maintenance improves; the System Strain decrease is equal to two points now instead of one. You never fail to install cyberware correctly. Once per patient, you can build and install a cyber modification to a system without any cost in money or experimental components, assuming you have the requisite skill levels to build it.

foci.name: Deadeye
foci.level_1: Gain Shoot skill. Ready stowed ranged weapon as Instant. Add Shoot level to damage.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Shoot as a bonus skill. You can Ready a Stowed ranged weapon as an Instant action. You may use a rifle or two-handed ranged weapon even when an enemy is within melee range, albeit at a -4 hit penalty. You may add your Shoot skill level to a ranged weapon’s damage roll.
foci.level_2: Reload as On Turn. No penalty for ranged weapons in melee. Once/scene auto-hit inanimate target.
foci.level_2_full: You can reload guns, crossbows, or other slow-loading weapons as an On Turn action, provided they don’t take more than a round to reload. You can use ranged weapons of any size in melee without penalty. Once per scene, as an On Turn action when target shooting at an inanimate, non-creature target, you automatically hit unless you roll a 2 on your Shoot skill check or the shot is physically impossible.

foci.name: Diplomat
foci.level_1: Gain Talk skill. Learn languages in a week. Reroll 1s on negotiation/diplomacy checks.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Talk as a bonus skill. You speak all the languages common to the city and can learn new ones to a workable level in a week, becoming fluent in a month. Reroll 1s on any skill check dice related to negotiation or diplomacy.
foci.level_2: Once/session shift NPC reaction one step toward friendly if you talk for 30s.
foci.level_2_full: Once per game session, shift an intelligent NPC’s reaction roll one step closer to friendly if you can talk to them for at least thirty seconds.

foci.name: Drone Pilot
foci.level_1: Gain Drive and Fix. Receive free drone budget. Repair drones without spare parts.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Drive and Fix as bonus skills. You acquire or start play with a Remote Control Unit cybersystem and its installation. Through connections, scavenging, and parts repurpose, you have free drones and their weapons and fittings worth no more than the budget given on page 18. You can repair these drones without needing spare parts, and destroyed drones can be replaced with a week’s work. You always have the equivalent of a drone repair kit on you at no Encumbrance cost.
foci.level_2: Assume Command is an On Turn action. Bonus Main Action for drones once/scene. Controlled drones +2 to hit.
foci.level_2_full: You can use the Assume Command drone action once per round as an On Turn action. Once per scene, gain a bonus Main Action to command a drone. Any drones you control gain a +2 bonus to their hit rolls, whether or not you’re personally firing their weaponry.

foci.name: Expert Programmer
foci.level_1: Gain Program skill. Maintain extra programs (Level+2). Once/day edit a program on-the-fly.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Program as a bonus skill. You can create and maintain an additional number of program elements equal to your character level+2, split among Verbs and Subjects as you see fit. You can change your choices with a week’s work. Once per day, as an On Turn action, you can make an on-the-fly edit to a Subject program element to turn it into any other Subject program element you need. The element remains altered until you change it again.
foci.level_2: Programs take half memory. Cyberdeck gains CPU bonus equal to Program skill.
foci.level_2_full: Your programs are exceedingly efficient. Any program elements you write take up only half the usual Memory. A cyberdeck you use gains a CPU bonus equal to your Program skill level.

foci.name: Healer
foci.level_1: Gain Heal skill. Stabilize adjacent person as On Turn. Roll 3d6 for Heal (drop lowest).
foci.level_1_full: Gain Heal as a bonus skill. You may attempt to stabilize one mortally-wounded adjacent person per round as an On Turn action. When rolling Heal skill checks, roll 3d6 and drop the lowest die.
foci.level_2: Healing devices heal twice as much. Heal group 1d6+Heal HP with 10 mins first aid (once/day).
foci.level_2_full: Pharmaceuticals or other technological healing devices applied by you heal twice as many hit points as normal. Using only basic medical supplies, you can heal 1d6+Heal skill hit points of damage to every injured or wounded person in your group with ten minutes of first aid spread among them. Such healing adds no System Strain, but can be applied to a given target only once per day.

foci.name: Henchkeeper
foci.level_1: Gain Talk skill. Acquire henchmen within 24 hours. (1 per 3 levels).
foci.level_1_full: Gain Talk as a bonus skill. You can acquire henchmen within 24 hours of arriving in a community, assuming anyone is suitable hench material. These henchmen will not fight except to save their own lives, but will go with you on missions and risk great danger to help you. Most corper henchmen will have 5 HP, a +0 attack bonus, and a Morale of 7, plus whatever gear they’re given. Slum-dwellers and other natives of harsh societies will fight as Street Thugs if pressed. You can have one henchmen at a time for every three character levels you have, rounded up. You can release henchmen with no hard feelings at any plausible time and pick them back up later should you be without a current henchman.
foci.level_2: Henchmen are remarkably loyal (Basic Corp Security stats).
foci.level_2_full: Your henchmen are remarkably loyal and determined, and will fight for you against anything but clearly overwhelming odds. Whether through natural competence or their devotion to you, they’re treated as a Basic Corp Security. You can make faithful henchmen out of skilled and highly-capable NPCs, but this requires that you actually have done them some favor or help that would reasonably earn such fierce loyalty.

foci.name: Many Faces
foci.level_1: Gain Sneak skill. Maintain one alternate identity per 3 character levels.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Sneak as a bonus skill. You can maintain one alternate identity at a time per three character levels, rounded up. These identities have their own names, backgrounds, criminal records, financial dealings, and bank accounts, and will register as authentic to all normal corporate and governmental checks. If an identity is compromised or you want a different one, you can replace it with a week’s work. False identities cannot be important people or involve corporations you don’t have a Contact in already.
foci.level_2: N/A

foci.name: Pop Idol
foci.level_1: Gain Talk or Exert skill. Mobilize 100 fans once/week. Earn $1,000 per level from fans.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Talk or Exert as a bonus skill. Once per game week, with an hour or so of messaging, you can mobilize about a hundred of your fans to perform some act of your choice, provided it’s no more than mildly criminal or slightly dangerous. Flash mobs, getaway drivers, scouting reports, tailing people, or instant parties might all qualify as services. Your fans don’t have any special skills, but they’ll do anything ordinary workers or civilians could do. If you mobilize them for donations or merch purchases, you get $1,000 per character level, doubled at fifth level and quadrupled at tenth. You can’t mobilize them to buy your content more than once per month.
foci.level_2: Mobilize 100 fans per level. Donation earnings double. Charisma mod +1 (max +2).
foci.level_2_full: You can mobilize up to a hundred fans per character level, though major mobs are likely to draw a law enforcement response. You’ve cultivated fan leaders who can pass along your wishes deniably, concealing your involvement in the crowd. Your donation and merch earning amounts double. Your Charisma modifier increases by +1, to a maximum of +2.

foci.name: Roamer
foci.level_1: Gain Exert, Notice, or Know; and Drive. Conversational in all local languages. Acquire free vehicle budget.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Exert, Notice, or Know as a bonus skill, plus Drive as a bonus skill. You have conversational skill in all common languages spoken in the region or city, and you never get lost. You have “acquired” one or more vehicles worth no more than the budget given on page 18. You can replace lost or damaged vehicles at a rate of $10,000 per week.
foci.level_2: Once/scene reroll a failed travel/vehicle operation skill check.
foci.level_2_full: Once per scene, as an Instant action, you can reroll a failed skill check related to safe traveling or vehicle operation, whether to fix a blown engine or talk down a ganger who doesn’t like strangers crossing his turf.

foci.name: Safe Haven
foci.description: Expert at finding secret bolt holes.
foci.level_1: Gain Sneak skill. Find/arrange a secure safehouse in any neighborhood (1 week).
foci.level_1_full: Gain Sneak as a bonus skill. If you spend a week in a particular neighborhood, you can find or arrange a secure safe house and the on-call assistance of a local cyberdoc or medic willing to perform emergency care for no more than you can afford to pay. This safe house will always go unnoticed unless you are at Heat 8+ or specifically compromise it; even in that case, it will remain undiscovered for at least 24 hours if you can get to it without being followed. If a safe house is burnt, you can find a new one with another week’s work. A PC can’t have more safe houses active at once than their character level.
foci.level_2: Safehouses are protected by local authorities and contain tech workshops/clinics.
foci.level_2_full: Your safe houses are actively protected by the local authorities, be they gang members, paid-off cops, or cooperative corp security. Provided you don’t make them angry, they’ll defend you from most ordinary degrees of pursuit. You can find safe havens geared with the equivalent of tech workshops or level one cyberclinics.

foci.name: Shocking Assault
foci.level_1: Gain Fight skill. Shock damage treats all targets as AC 10.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Fight as a bonus skill. The Shock damage of your weapon treats all targets as if they were AC 10, assuming your weapon is capable of harming the target in the first place and the target is not immune to Shock.
foci.level_2: Gain a +2 bonus to Shock damage rating.
foci.level_2_full: In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to the Shock damage rating of all melee weapons and unarmed attacks that do Shock. As usual, regular hits never do less damage than this Shock would do.

foci.name: Sniper’s Eye
foci.level_1: Gain Shoot skill. Roll 3d6 (drop lowest) for ranged Execution Attacks.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Shoot as a bonus skill. When making a skill check for a ranged Execution Attack or target shooting, roll 3d6 and drop the lowest die.
foci.level_2: Never miss ranged Execution Attacks. Target takes -4 to save and double damage.
foci.level_2_full: You don’t miss ranged Execution Attacks. A target hit by one takes a -4 penalty on the Physical saving throw to avoid immediate mortal injury. Even if the save is successful, the target takes double the normal damage inflicted by the attack.

foci.name: Specialist
foci.level_1: Gain a non-combat skill. Roll 3d6 (drop lowest) for all checks with it.
foci.level_1_full: Gain a non-combat skill as a bonus. Roll 3d6 and drop the lowest die for all skill checks in this skill.
foci.level_2: Roll 4d6 (drop two lowest) for all checks with that skill.
foci.level_2_full: Roll 4d6 and drop the two lowest dice for all skill checks in this skill.

foci.name: Tinker
foci.level_1: Gain Fix skill. Maintenance score doubled. Gear mods cost half price.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Fix as a bonus skill. Your Maintenance score is doubled, allowing you to maintain twice as many mods. Vehicle, cyber, and gear mods cost only half their usual price in dollars, though experimental component requirements remain the same.
foci.level_2: Fix skill treated as one level higher for mods. Advanced mods require fewer components.
foci.level_2_full: Your Fix skill is treated as one level higher for purposes of building and maintaining mods and calculating your Maintenance score, up to a maximum of Fix-5. Advanced mods require one fewer experimental components to make, down to a minimum of zero.

foci.name: Unarmed Combatant
foci.level_1: Gain Fight skill. Unarmed damage scales with skill level (up to 1d12+1). Gain Shock quality.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Fight as a bonus skill. Your unarmed attacks become more dangerous as your Fight skill increases. At level-0, they do 1d6 damage. At level-1, they do 1d8 damage. At level-2 they do 1d10, level-3 does 1d12, and level-4 does 1d12+1. At Fight-1 or better, they have the Shock quality equal to your Fight skill against AC 15 or less. While you normally add your Fight skill level to any unarmed damage you inflict, don’t add it twice to Shock damage. If you choose to strike lethally with unarmed attacks, they have a Trauma Die of 1d6 and a Trauma Rating of x2.
foci.level_2: Deal 1d6 damage even on a miss. Trauma Die for lethal attacks becomes 1d8.
foci.level_2_full: Even on a miss with a Fight attack, you do an unmodified 1d6 damage, plus any Shock that the blow might inflict on the target. Your Trauma Die becomes 1d8 for lethal attacks.

foci.name: Unique Gift
foci.level_1: Gain a character-defining ability that provides options not normally available.
foci.level_1_full: Your PC has a unique piece of cyberware, an exceptional human ability, or some experimental genetic modification that grants them some benefit that isn’t covered under existing options. This benefit shouldn’t be a simple bonus to something you already do; it should be a power or ability that gives you options that you just wouldn’t have otherwise. It also shouldn’t be used to simply optimize an existing character concept, but instead should allow you to make a character who wouldn’t make sense without this special ability.
foci.level_2: N/A

foci.name: Unregistered
foci.description: You do not exist in databases.
foci.level_1: No government/corp records associated with you. Cannot use banks/own formal property.
foci.level_1_full: You have no government or corporate database records associated with you, and it is almost impossible to add any such records without them ending up corrupted or deleted within a week. Human beings can remember you, but they can’t rely on computerized records to keep track of you or your activities. You can keep money on credit chips or in cash, but banking or formal property ownership is almost impossible for you.
foci.level_2: N/A

foci.name: Whirlwind Assault
foci.level_1: Gain Fight skill. Once/scene apply Shock damage to all foes in range as On Turn.
foci.level_1_full: Gain Fight as a bonus skill. Once per scene, as an On Turn action, apply your Shock damage to all foes within melee range, assuming they’re susceptible to your Shock.
foci.level_2: The first time you kill someone in a round, instantly gain a second attack.
foci.level_2_full: The first time you kill someone in a round with a normal attack, either with its rolled damage on a hit or with the Shock damage it inflicts, instantly gain a second attack on any target within range using any Ready weapon you have.
